newsitem.title: UK: UK's ITV criticised for over reliance on drama.
newsitem.headline: UK's ITV criticised for over reliance on drama.

text.p: Britain's Independent Television Commission (ITC) criticised the ITV commercial network on Tuesday for an over-reliance on drama and called on it to boost its comedy programming.

"The drama is good but the problem is one of diversity. It is crowding out other things and space must be made for these," ITC chief executive Peter Rogers said as the watchdog published its 1996 performance reviews.
"We would say to ITV licensees...'Please, please, please try to get back into comedy,'" he added.

The ITC, which regulates commercial television, acknowledged that ITV had faced a difficult year in 1996 as its terrestrial rivals held their own or boosted audience share, while cable and satellite viewing passed the 10 percent mark.
It praised high standards from ITV in several areas but was critical of the reduction in airtime given by the network to documentaries, arts and childen's drama.
The ITV network, which groups 15 regional licensees including the big three of Granada, Carlton and United News & Media, expressed surprise at the ITC's criticism of its drama scheduling.
